Articles.Content:
This bug kind of feels like how Danny2462 typically breaks the universe.

So I just landed a habitation module moon base ship on the mun. It was able to house 20 kerbals, and what do you do when you land a space station with that many kerbals on board? Obviously, you take a picture of them all. About 15 minutes into lining the kerbals up, I was perhaps on the 17th one. When he it the ground and fell over, the screen suddenly went black, and the altimeter went berserk. In addition, when I tried to return to the space center, it showed a black screen with a back arrow. This made me think of danny's video when he went into the jool atmosphere and broke the universe in a similar manner.

Link to the video is right

if you haven't seen it. (2:45 if you are impatient)

Have you had this happen? Under what circumstances? Please discuss.
Yeah, I was kind of mad but it was also funny. Luckily, I didn't have that much in that game yet so I didn't lose that many things.
Wait, so was everything was permanently screwed up, even after reloading the game? And I never managed to implode the universe, even when I actually try.
I blew up kerbol because of that.
I accomplished this a couple days ago. I was testing a new lander, I crashed, the entire game had a seizure, repeating the same five frames, and repeating the same sound.
Yeah, happened to me recently when I was doing an unmanned rocket test for an escape pod, and it had put a kerbal in the pod. I just let him jump off and it went berserk.
